moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: The Ruy Lopez Opening. White threatens the defender of e5 in an attempt to gain an advantage in development and tempo.
moves.3... Nge7: Although this blocks the DSB, it ensures that a knight will remain on c6 if I capture. The DSB can always be fianchettoed later.
moves.4. O-O: I castle, getting my king to safety.
moves.4... d6 5. Nc3: I develop my other knight, putting another claim on d5.
moves.5... Bd7: Breaking my pin of the knight onto the king.
moves.6. d4: I contest the centre and try to open up the position a little.
moves.7. d5: An attempt to attack the knight, but is dxe5 better?
moves.7... Nb8: The knight moves back to its original square.
moves.8. Bxd7+: I'm not sure if this was the best move. Does anyone know?
moves.8... Nxd7 9. Be3: I develop my final minor piece.
moves.10... Be7: Developing the DSB and preparing to castle.
moves.11. Rad1: Controlling my side of the d-file.
moves.11... h6: My DSB's squares are now being heavily restricted.
moves.12. h3: I actually don't know why I did this. What would be a better move?
moves.13. Qd2: I don't want to do Bxg5 or Nxg5 because it opens up the h-file.
moves.13... Bxe3 14. Qxe3 O-O: At this stage, would you say the position is about equal? If the position is close enough, I tend not to be so good at position analysis.
moves.17... Qe7 18. Ng3 Qf6 19. Nh5: At this stage, I am trying to get a draw by third repetition...
moves.20. a3: Preparing to do b4. Probably not such a good move.
moves.21... f5: Attempting to open up the position.
moves.24. bxa5: ?? This was my first real blunder in this game, simply because it loses a knight. The game swiftly goes downhill for me from here.
moves.24... Qxh5 25. Qa4: Defending a5 while threatening d7 at the same time.
moves.25... Nc5 26. Qb4: As Pete said, Qb5 is better because I get more possible squares to move to.
moves.27. Nd4 Nh4: The pressure is mounting on my kingside...
moves.28... Nxg2 29. Kxg2: Taking the knight while defending h3.
moves.29... Rf3: The fall of h3 is now inevitable.
moves.30. Kg1 Qxh3: With each move, my situation becomes more dire.
moves.31. Rfe1: Preventing mate by Qg4+ followed by Rh3#.
moves.33... Rxf3+ 34. Ke2: Here I resign, because Qg2# is inevitable. Please give constructive criticism and advice. Well played bigpeta.
